items.title: How to Clear 500,000 Feral Cats From New York’s Streets
items.abstract: After the pandemic boom in pet adoption gave way to pet abandonment, locals in Brooklyn are trying a controversial approach to population control.

items.title: New York City Sues Queens Library Architects Over Lack of Accessibility
items.abstract: City officials argued that the building was not compliant with the Americans With Disabilities Act and other laws.

items.title: How the Head of a Filmmaking Center Spends His Sundays
items.abstract: Jon Alpert has shared his love for documentaries with New Yorkers for more than 50 years.

items.title: Meet the Roving Veterinarians Caring for Mexico’s Rural Horses
items.abstract: Horses, donkeys and mules can be a lifeline for families living in the countryside, but there haven’t always been vets around to treat them.

items.title: N.Y.C. Officials Tangle With State Over Sleep Ban at Homeless Centers
items.abstract: The city has continued to enforce the policy to prevent young people from sleeping at the centers. Advocates for homeless youth have called the policy cruel.
